title: Ticket #3107: Should Condor reset signal handling to defaults?
description:
The current stable release of Debian has a bug where Condor and other daemons may be started SIGINT set to ignored. This breaks our dmtcp_shim and potentially any other user jobs expecting SIGINT on eviction. This specific issue is #3094.

More generally, should Condor run through all of the signals and restore them to the default handler on startup, or perhaps just before launching a user job? This would solve this problem for anyone with this specific problem and potentially other cases. Is there a good reason to respect the signal handling that we've inherited?
